_header: For I wend when any folly me felt
_description: On the value of prayer — twenty-nine rhyming lines in the prose treatise, Pupilla Oculi

CamTCC1053.First Lines:
ffor I wend when any foly me felteIn þought or speche or any
                    gylte…
CamTCC1053.Last Lines:
…Wylke grace þorough his grete myghtsall þe saue
                    bothe daye and nyght Amen
CamTCC1053.Note: Written as prose, with double strokes to divide lines.
CamTCC1053.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 30.
